intro: Oxytropis czekanowskii, commonly known as the Czekanowsky's locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or pink. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Oxytropis czekanowskii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and at high elevations.
